story_arc: promise → course → data-staircase → pro/con → verdict → alternatives

primary_trope.name: extreme_elevation
primary_trope.hook_text: Only a handful of races score 5/5 on Elevation. Bootlegger 100 is one.
primary_trope.mechanism: Curiosity gap (specific) — knowing a perfect score exists but not why triggers dopamine anticipation.

beats.label: HOOK + PROMISE
beats.narration: Should you race Bootlegger 100? I rated 328 gravel races on 14 dimensions. Bootlegger 100 scored 70 out of 100. Elite tier. Here's what that actually means for your season.
beats.editing_note: STATE THE PREMISE IN 8 SECONDS. Clear value prop: 'I rated 328 races. Here's where this one lands.' This is the 8-second decision window. Viewers who stay past 15s are 58% more likely to finish.
beats.psych_mechanism: Curiosity gap (specific) + IKEA effect (viewer predicts the tier before reveal).

beats.label: THE COURSE
beats.narration: Bootlegger 100. Dahlonega, Georgia (North Georgia mountains). 100 mi. 100 miles, 10 thousand ft. 80% gravel, 20% dirt. North Georgia mountains. Steep climbs, technical descents. Technical rating: 4/5.
beats.text_on_screen: Bootlegger 100 | Dahlonega, Georgia (North Georgia mountains) | 100 mi
beats.editing_note: Let the course breathe. Show the route map, then cut to terrain-specific B-roll. This is the SETUP phase — grounding the viewer before the data analysis. Pacing: 25-40 sec cuts.

beats.label: THE SCORES — Top 8
beats.narration: Let's go through the scores. Elevation. 5 out of 5. Mountainous. Your granny gear will earn its keep. 10,000 feet over 100 miles in North Georgia mountains - this is vertical punishment. Length. 4 out of 5. This is a long day. Plan accordingly. 107 miles with 10,604 feet of climbing creates the distance-elevation combination that defines mountain gravel suffering. Technicality. 4 out of 5. Bike handling matters here. Practice your descents. K-Dogg describes descents with "dump trucks of marbles strewn everywhere" that caused hand cramps from "desperately clutching the brakes. Adventure. 4 out of 5. The kind of ride you'll tell stories about. Wilson Creek Gorge puts you deep into North Georgia mountain isolation where cell service dies and self-reliance matters. Race Quality. 4 out of 5. The kind of race that spoils you for others. Pisgah Productions knows how to put on events - they've built a series around this terrain for a reason. Experience. 4 out of 5. The kind of race that reshapes your season. 10,000 feet of climbing over 100 miles through North Georgia mountains creates the kind of suffering that bonds riders for life. Community. 4 out of 5. Strong community. This race builds friendships. K-Dogg describes "a huge crowd of cheerful and polite adventurers" with opportunities for "toccata conversations with riders from many scattered states. Value. 4 out of 5. Good value. More bang for your buck than most. You're paying for 100 miles of North Georgia mountain punishment - that's substantial course for the money.
beats.editing_note: PROGRESSIVE RHYTHM: start tight (15-20 sec per dimension), slow down for the most interesting scores (30-40 sec). Each score: number appears, brief pause, explanation. Avatar reacts to extreme scores (5/5 = chef_kiss, 1/5 = facepalm). RE-ENGAGEMENT at 3:00 mark: insert a surprising score reveal or a meme reaction to break the pattern.

meme_insert.suggested_clip: avatar reaction to most extreme score

beats.label: THE SCORES — Also Scored
beats.narration: The rest, in rapid succession. Logistics. 3 out of 5. Adequate. The word was invented for this. Climate. 3 out of 5. The weather could go either way. Prestige. 3 out of 5. Established race. Solid reputation. Field Depth. 3 out of 5. Deep enough to push you. Expenses. 3 out of 5. Mid-range expenses. Budget a proper race weekend. Altitude. 1 out of 5. Oxygen plentiful. Power output normal.
beats.editing_note: FAST PACING — 7 seconds per dimension. Quick-fire energy change from the deep analysis above. This is a PATTERN INTERRUPT through pacing shift.

beats.label: STRENGTHS
beats.visual: Strengths list overlay with positive visual treatment
beats.editing_note: Warm energy. Each strength gets its own card. Avatar genuinely positive.

beats.label: WEAKNESSES
beats.narration: What they don't put on the website.
beats.visual: Weaknesses list with warning visual treatment
beats.editing_note: MIDPOINT RE-ENGAGEMENT. This is ~55% through. Open with burst sequence (quick cuts, warning sounds). Then deliver weaknesses honestly. Preview what's coming: 'Now, should you actually do this race?' [RIFF HERE] at the transition.

beats.label: LOGISTICS
beats.narration: Travel, lodging, and the unsexy details.

broll_sources.query: Dahlonega, Georgia (North Georgia mountains) travel guide

beats.editing_note: Utility section. Lower energy, practical value. Hybrid Tempo: alternate fast logistics items (10-15 sec) with slow map visuals (30 sec).

beats.label: VERDICT
beats.narration: Verdict: Southeast Mountain Gravel. You need proper gravel legs and mechanical confidence before diving into Pisgah Productions' playground. The terrain doesn't negotiate, and being 100 miles deep in the NC mountains isn't the place to discover your limits. Show up undertrained and you'll spend more time walking than riding.
beats.editing_note: CLOSE THE MAIN LOOP. 0.5s silence before verdict. Tier badge slams in. Avatar delivers final take. DO NOT signal 'wrapping up' — maintain energy.

beats.label: ALTERNATIVES
beats.narration: If Bootlegger 100 isn't quite right for you. Dirty Kanza offers similar distance with less technical punishment if you prefer power over bike handling. For the full Appalachian experience without quite this level of commitment, try Trans-Sylvania Epic's individual stages.
beats.editing_note: Bonus value — viewers who reach this point are highly engaged. Cross-reference other videos/races.

beats.label: CTA
beats.narration: Full breakdown on the site. Fourteen scored dimensions. Free race prep kit. Link in the description.
beats.editing_note: End ABRUPTLY after CTA. No 'thanks for watching' wind-down.
beats.engagement_question: Have you raced Bootlegger 100? Did we get the score right? Drop it in the comments.

meme_inserts.suggested_clip: avatar reaction to most extreme score

thumbnail_prompt: South Park style flat cutout character, dramatic pose, 'Bootlegger 100' bold text, tier badge 'ELITE', high contrast red/yellow/white, cycling gear, handlebar mustache --ar 16:9 --cref [CHARACTER_URL]

cross_platform_notes.youtube: Primary platform. SEO-optimize title for '[Race Name] review'.
cross_platform_notes.extract_shorts: Pull 3-5 Shorts: hook, biggest surprise score, verdict.
cross_platform_notes.blog: Cross-reference the race profile page for search traffic.
